body: Following successful protests in Tunisia and Egypt, aided in part by social media, The Armenian Observer reports that the extra-parliamentary opposition in Armenia hope to replicate attempts to overthrow the government with Facebook. However, the blog notes, with usage incredibly low, such hopes might be sorely misguided.

However, the blog notes, with usage incredibly low, such hopes might be sorely misguided.
title: Armenia: Facebook revolution?

sentence: Following successful protests in Tunisia and Egypt, aided in part by social media, The Armenian Observer reports that the extra-parliamentary opposition in Armenia hope to replicate attempts to overthrow the government with Facebook.
However, the blog notes, with usage incredibly low, such hopes might be sorely misguided.
